snippet: The Atlantic Coast Conference said the Irish would play five football games a year against league opponents and be a full member in all sports except football and hockey.
abstract: Notre Dame will join the Atlantic Coast Conference as a full member, by 2015 at the latest but preferably earlier, in all sports except for hockey and football; Notre Dame's departure signifies another blow for the once-powerful Big East, which has had West Virginia, Syracuse and Pittsburgh announce their exits in the past year.
lead_paragraph: The Atlantic Coast Conference said the Irish would play five football games a year against league opponents and be a full member in all sports except football and hockey.

headline.seo: Notre Dame to Join A.C.C. in All Sports but Football and Hockey
headline.main: A.C.C. to Add Notre Dame, but Not Its Football Team
headline.print_headline: A.C.C. to Get the Irish, But Not for Football
